decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive plays using hatebears to disrupt opponent's strategies. It utilizes cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Cavern of Souls to provide card advantage and uncounterable creatures. With cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine, the deck can target opponent's lands while accelerating its own mana base with Moxen and Ancient Tomb. Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria further disrupt opponent's plans, while White Plume Adventurer and Witch Enchanter provide additional creature support. The deck also includes removal like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently.

This deck aims to combine aggressive creature plays with midrange control elements, utilizing the power of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Orcish Bowmasters to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Fatal Push. The inclusion of a companion like Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for additional value and recursion, making it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the deck's relentless pace and versatility. The deck also includes powerful disruptive spells and card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to solidify its position as a dominant force in Vintage 1 vs 1.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play early on, while using a combination of counter spells and disruption to control the game. It also utilizes key artifacts such as Time Vault and Manifold Key for additional win conditions. Additionally, it includes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns for versatility and Atraxa, Grand Unifier for synergy with other cards in the deck. The deck aims to outmaneuver opponents with a combination of card advantage, powerful threats, and disruptive elements.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact-based cards, focusing on resource denial through land destruction and taxing effects. The deck's strategy revolves around using Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland to limit the opponent's resources while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Stonecoil Serpent. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Mana Crypt allows for explosive starts, while cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Sphere of Resistance disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck seeks to establish dominance through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful win condition by utilizing the card Doomsday to stack the library in a specific order to ensure victory. With cards like Dark Ritual and Demonic Tutor, the deck aims to quickly set up the combo while also having disruption and card draw to protect the combo. Thassa's Oracle serves as the primary win condition, with the ability to win the game on the spot once the library is stacked correctly. The deck is designed to be fast, resilient, and able to win the game in a single turn.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting your opponent's mana base while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Null Rod, you can hinder your opponent's ability to cast spells effectively while deploying threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Laelia, the Blade Reforged to close out the game quickly. With powerful mana acceleration from cards like Sol Ring and Mana Crypt, this deck aims to establish control of the board early on and maintain pressure until your opponent is overwhelmed.
